title: Who were the last 10 American presidents? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America

response.answer_text: JFK — Second youngest president (after TR); first of the WW2 “Greatest Generation” to become president (the last was Bush 41); known for having a pretty wife, and yet he cheated. But at least he saved the world during Cuban Missile Crisis. Lyndon Johnson (LBJ) — Skilled Texan pol who, by signing landmark Civil Rights legislation, gave the white South to the Republicans; he’d be a great president for that, except his reputation was destroyed by staying in the Vietnam War, an unpopular war that couldn’t be won. Nixon — Could’ve been a near-great president, thanks to his opening communication with Russia and China, but he was done in by Vietnam War and Watergate, a “third rate burglary” of Democratic Headquarters that he tried to cover up. Only president ever forced to resign. Ford — Nixon’s well-meaning replacement. Not a bad man, but was parodied by Chevy Chase on the new show, SNL. Carter — Peanut farmer from Georgia; “born again” but moderately liberal. Like Ford, he had bad luck on the economy… he also lost points because of the Iran Hostage crisis, even if it wasn’t his fault. Had one great success: peace between Israel and Egypt. Reagan — Cowboy president and “Great Communicator.” Former movie actor. Tried “supply side” economics but later had to raise taxes. Stood up to “Evil Empire” (Russia) but later decided to talk to Gorbachev. At least he showed the virtue of being able to change his mind. Bush “41” — Won the First Iraq War but paid less attention to the economy. Lost his re-election by poor debate performance in which he looked at his watch and didn’t know what the price of milk was. Bill Clinton — “Slick Willy” to some; “Bubba” to others, despite his being a Rhodes Scholar. Eight years of peace and prosperity, and first budget surplus in generations, all marred by a scandal with an intern. He felt your pain. Bush “43” — “W.” went back into Iraq, but unlike his Daddy, he went all the way to Baghdad and tried to occupy it. Badly blew the Clinton budget surplus. Barack Obama — Started with a disastrous economy handed to him by “W.” and then turned it around. Finally got bin Laden. ObamaCare, still controversial. Obama was a constitutional law prof and country’s first non-white president. And then there’s Trump… probably will never down calling all of Africa “sh*thole countries.”

(1)Barack Obama-Barack Hussein Obama II is an American politician and attorney who served as the 44th president of the United States from 2009 to 2017. A member of the Democratic Party, Barack Obama was the first African-American president of the United States. (2)George W. Bush- George Walker Bush is an American politician and businessman who served as the 43rd president of the United States from 2001 to 2009. A member of the Republican Party, he had previously served as the 46th governor of Texas from 1995 to 2000. (3)William Clinton- William Jefferson Clinton is an American politician who served as the 42nd president of the United States from 1993 to 2001. Prior to his presidency, he served as governor of Arkansas and as attorney general of Arkansas. (4)George Bush- George Herbert Walker Bush was an American politician and businessman who served as the 41st president of the United States from 1989 to 1993. (5)Ronald Reagan- Ronald Wilson Reagan was an American politician who served as the 40th president of the United States from 1981 to 1989 and became a highly influential voice of modern conservatism. Prior to his presidency, he was a Hollywood actor and union leader before serving as the 33rd governor of California from 1967 to 1975. (6)James Earl Carter- James Earl Carter Jr. is an American politician, philanthropist, and former farmer who served as the 39th president of the United States from 1977 to 1981. A member of the Democratic Party, he previously served as a Georgia State Senator from 1963 to 1967 and as the 76th governor of Georgia from 1971 to 1975. (7)Gerald R. Ford- Gerald Rudolph Ford Jr. was an American politician who served as the 38th president of the United States from August 1974 to January 1977. Before his accession to the presidency, Ford served as the 40th vice president of the United States from December 1973 to August 1974. (8)Richard M.Nixon- Richard Milhous Nixon was the 37th president of the United States, serving from 1969 until 1974. A member of the Republican Party, Nixon previously served as the 36th vice president from 1953 to 1961, having risen to national prominence as a representative and senator from California. (9)Lyndon B. Johnson- Lyndon Baines Johnson, often referred to by his initials LBJ, was an American politician who served as the 36th president of the United States from 1963 to 1969 and formerly, 37th vice president from 1961 to 1963. He assumed the presidency following the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. (10)John F. Kennedy- John Fitzgerald Kennedy, often referred to by his initials JFK and Jack, was an American politician who served as the 35th president of the United States from January 1961 until his assassination in November 1963.
